attributes.action: Transgenders should only be allowed to take part in their original sex's sports.
attributes.additional_details: It simply is not fair - for example, if a biological male who identifies as a female takes part in a women's 100m race, the biological male would have an advantage against the women, as men biologically have greater muscle mass.
attributes.background: Ban those who are transgender to participate in their original sex's sports, such as in the Olympics. For example, a biological male who identifies as a female should not be allowed to take part in an Olympics game consisting of and only allowing women.

rejection.details:
Deciding who should be eligible to take part in individual sporting events are a matter for the organisers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

In the UK Section 195 of the Equality Act 2010 allows sports competition organisers to "exclude participation of a transsexual person as a competitor in a gender-affected activity if it is necessary to do so to secure in relation [...] fair competition, or the safety of competitors": https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2010/15/section/195
